channel.title: Chinatown on Gourmand Syndrome
channel.description: Recent content in Chinatown on Gourmand Syndrome

item.title: Bridges
item.description: Bridges opened in the late fall last year, and is headed by chef Sam Lawrence who came from Estela, which is on our list to hit. Lately, this restaurant has been getting some notoriety for having good food and a good ambiance. It’s a bit difficult to get to since you have to walk a bit from the subway entrance. I was able to book a reservation for 2 for the bar about a few days in advance for 5:45 PM.

item.title: Kono
item.description: Kono has been something on my radar for quite some time. It’s been a bit since we’ve splurged quality yakitori, so I was able to snipe a reservation for a Saturday night out at 5:30 PM fairly quickly on Resy. Chef Atsushi “ATS” Kono was originally at Torishin, and after looking at the menu, I was excited to see what this experience brought. This restaurant focused on kappo-style yakitori omakase featuring organic Amish chicken and seasonable vegetables.

item.title: Au Cheval
item.description: Au Cheval is well known restaurant based out of Chicago. They specialize in elevated burgers and American dishes. When they opened a New York City location, there were crazy lines out the door. The bigger brother to this restaurant is “4 Charles” which specializes in prime rib. Both the burger and prime rib sandwich at Au Cheval are also found at “4 Charles”. I don’t have the patience to book a “4 Charles” reservation and pay the crazy insane prices for steak, so I thought I’d try some of their offerings here.

item.title: House Special
item.description: Summary This place is in Chinatown off of Hester St. We were looking for Cantonese style cuisine, and honestly there was nothing spectacular or bad. The pea shoots with garlic had a taste of wine flavor to it, and was good. The pepper salted pork chops was good as well. It would have been nice if they added more peppers and scallions. The pepper salted shrimp was just ok for me.

item.title: 456 New Shanghai
item.description: Summary Stumbled onto this just walking around. Was interested in salted pepper pork chops. All we got for a quick afternoon snack was just pan fried rice cakes with pork and the pork chops. Nothing to write home about, but the food was good for what we ordered. Note that we did not order the soup dumplings because frankly there are a gazillion other places to order this, so why would you order it here?

item.title: To Two Boonsik
item.description: This place is ok. Got the japchae and soondobu. Cheap though.

item.title: Tofu Tofu
item.description: Pretty good soon dobu and bo ssam. Lots of food for 1 person. Would come back here again if I was craving bo ssasm I think.

item.title: Joes Shanghai
item.description: Was good and cheap, but not like amazing. LA XLBs still better.

item.title: Dim Sum Go Go
item.description: This place is very bleh for dim sum. I was the only Asian diner.

item.title: Sunshine
item.description: Dim sum is ok. Less wait than Jing Fong. Chicken feeet not as good as LA. This is PERMA closed.
